SENT.plain: A 32-year-old, right-handed man presented with chronic headache persisting for the past 5 years
On admission, neurological examination revealed mild papilledema and bitemporal defects of the visual fields
Computed tomography showed a hypodense lesion in the suprasellar region

Magnetic resonance imaging revealed a 2.2 x 2.4 x 2.5-cm heterogeneously hyperintense lesion in the suprasellar region and an infarct region in the right basal ganglia on the T(1)- and T(2)-weighted images
The lesion was subtotally removed because part of the capsule was tightly adherent to important surrounding neurovascular structures
Histological analysis confirmed the diagnosis of dermoid cyst
Ruptured intracranial dermoid cyst may manifest as infarction in the basal ganglia caused by localized arterial inflammatory reaction combined with compression of the right internal carotid artery
